description: Dumbarton keeper Danny Rogers is in top form to earn his side a point against 10-man Queen of the South.
title: Dumbarton 0-0 Queen of the South
title_page: Dumbarton 0-0 Queen of the South - BBC Sport
maintext:
Dumbarton keeper Danny Rogers was in top form to earn his side a point against 10-man Queen of the South.
The Sons number one kept out Lewis Kidd's early effort before Queens' Ian McShane hit the post with a header.
Rogers then saved efforts from Mark Miller and McShane, and Dumbarton's Archie Campbell fired wide after going clean through on goal.
Queens striker Derek Lyle was sent off in stoppage time after an altercation with Campbell.
